results.definition: a movement forward
examples: he listened for the progress of the troops

results.definition: a change for the better; progress in development
a tentative suggestion designed to elicit the reactions of others
examples: she rejected his advances

results.definition: the act of moving forward (as toward a goal)
an amount paid before it is earned
increase in price or value
examples: the news caused a general advance on the stock market

results.definition: move forward, also in the metaphorical sense
examples: Time marches on

results.definition: bring forward for consideration or acceptance
examples: advance an argument

results.definition: increase or raise
examples: boost the voltage in an electrical circuit

results.definition: contribute to the progress or growth of
examples: I am promoting the use of computers in the classroom

results.definition: cause to move forward
examples: Can you move the car seat forward?

results.definition: obtain advantages, such as points, etc.
examples: The home team was gaining ground
After defeating the Knicks, the Blazers pulled ahead of the Lakers in the battle for the number-one playoff berth in the Western Conference

results.definition: develop in a positive way
examples: He progressed well in school
My plants are coming along
Plans are shaping up

results.definition: develop further
examples: We are advancing technology every day

results.definition: give a promotion to or assign to a higher position
examples: John was kicked upstairs when a replacement was hired
Women tend not to advance in the major law firms
I got promoted after many years of hard work

results.definition: pay in advance
examples: Can you advance me some money?

results.definition: move forward
examples: we have to advance clocks and watches when we travel eastward

results.definition: rise in rate or price
examples: The stock market gained 24 points today

results.definition: being ahead of time or need
examples: gave advance warning
was beforehand with her report

results.definition: situated ahead or going before
examples: an advance party
at that time the most advanced outpost was still east of the Rockies
